body_html:
You can try using a placeholder and feed_dict. Here is an example courtesy of @mrry:

bigarray = np.zeros((1024, 1024, 1024), dtype=np.float32)
p = tf.placeholder(tf.float32, shape=bigarray.shape)
v = tf.Variable(p)
sess = tf.Session()
sess.run(tf.initialize_all_variables(), feed_dict={p: bigarray})
sess.run(tf.reduce_sum(v))

body:
You can try using a placeholder and feed_dict. Here is an example courtesy of @mrry:

> > > bigarray = np.zeros((1024, 1024, 1024), dtype=np.float32)
> > > p = tf.placeholder(tf.float32, shape=bigarray.shape)
> > > v = tf.Variable(p)
> > > sess = tf.Session()
> > > sess.run(tf.initialize_all_variables(), feed_dict={p: bigarray})
> > > sess.run(tf.reduce_sum(v))
